Identifying and characterizing the genomes and phenotypes of novel microbes found in space habitats is integral for expanding our genomic databases of space-relevant microbes . This approach offers the only reliable method to determine species composition, track microbial dispersion, and anticipate potential threats to human health .
B<sup>T. and F6_8S_P_1C belonged to four different genera: Arthrobacter, Leifsonia

Spore-forming strains were heat shocked (80 °C for 10 min) then plated on Tryptic Soy Agar (TSA) and grown at 30 °c for 5 days to induce endospore formation . Endospore staining with malachite green and safranin was performed using the Schaeffer-Fulton method .
Sequencing of prepared libraries was carried out on a NovaSeq 6000 S4 flow cell paired-end 2 × 150-bp platform . The read qualities were evaluated using FastQC v.11.7 and Fastp v0.20 .
The trees were rooted using a related species within the same family . They were visualized using Interactive Tree of Life (iTOL)
The identified BGCs were curated for functional annotation using MIBiG v.3.1 . The six strains belonged to five novel species spanning four bacterial genera .
The novel species is thought to be related to humans . The species is closely related to each other . It is the first novel species to be found in the world .

The 16S rRNA gene may not be an adequate marker for distinguishing members within this genus . The 16RDNA-based phylogenetic tree encompassing all <em>Arthrobacter> species found strain IIF3SC-B10<sup>T. was found to be distinct from the <em>.A. ruber, A. cheniae and <em  F6_8S_P_1A exhibited low dDDH values (28.3%) and ANI indices (86.3%), providing further evidence that it belongs to a novel species . The next closest member was <em>L. soli (ANI 86.3%).
The strain F6_3S_P_1C displayed a 99.8% similarity to <em>S. thermotolerans . This finding highlights the difficulty in classifying spore-forming microorganisms using the 16S rRNA gene marker .

The <em>Leifsonia . species did not show any specific phenotypic characteristics that could be used to differentiate them from other closely related <em >Leifesonia . Species . were able to grow at 8% NaCl which can be used as discriminative test. Oxidase test was also positive .
The study of Leifsonia is published in the journal Tab4 . The study was published on October 31, 2013 .

New launch technology and investment in human exploration of space by governments and private industry are leading to a revitalization of the idea of long-term space habitation . Missions to the moon are already underway, and missions to Mars are planned for the near future . Microbiome of the ISS will need to be monitored for multiple reasons: spread of pathogens through the air or on surfaces which could

The acriflavin resistance protein (AcrA) is a crucial component of the AcrAB-TolC efflux pump . AcrA's function may aid in the development of strategies to combat antibiotic resistance . Understanding streptothricin's mode of action and resistance mechanisms contributes to our knowledge of antibiotics .

The magnesium and cobalt efflux protein (CorC) plays a significant role in maintaining metal ion homeostasis, protecting against metal toxicity, facilitating adaptation to metal-rich environments . Its activity is important for cellular functions and can also impact antibiotic resistance .

Study of novel microbes and predicted bioactive compounds contributes to our understanding of the microbial ecosystem on the ISS . Discovery could contribute to the development of improved antimicrobial therapies and strategies to combat antibiotic resistance .

Solibacillus kalamii was isolated from an air filter aboard the International Space Station . Solibaceillus klamii was found to be isolated from a filter aboard a space station air filter .
The study was published in the journal Bioinformatics journal Biomedi.org . The authors are currently on a mission to improve the quality of the study .
